definition: (Tw) to pull sth up/(fig.) to give a boost to/to support
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
to lift/to raise/(of two or more persons) to carry
stock market index/share price index/abbr. for 股票指數|股票指数[gu3 piao4 zhi3 shu4]
to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
(of a stock price or market index) currently higher than at the previous day's close
to fall back (of water level or share prices)
(of sales, prices etc) to fall/to drop/decline/slump
to take money or valuables out of storage/to recover/to ship goods/to extract (chemicals from solution)
to regurgitate/(fig.) (of a stock market) to give up (gains)
